column4: first problem: webcam ( ID 5986:0241 ) from my notebook positivo premium, to solve this problem I've tried to install uvcdriver and patched it, but it didn't work. So they told me that I could try to use ndiswrapper to install the webcam. But I can't do that without internet no notebook
so, I tried to make a network between desktop ( win7 ) and notebook (ubuntu 9.10) => it didn't working too
so, I thought a lot things to solve this problem with local internet
and I didn't know to solve
run a tempary cable -  is proberly the easiest way
clarify what dosetn work exactly then.
ive never heard of it being used for webcams
then it may fall in the 'totally unsupported' catagory
on ubuntu 9.10? or some other disrto?
whats that from? dmesg output? thats just shows its detected the device.. dosent mean its supported.
when I make lsmod |grep uvcdriver => it shows nothing
i notices some issues with vlc the other day and some video files - they were not playjng properly on the netbook. gnom-mplayer handled them fine however..
not sure what format they are. They were HD. video i know.
yep. testing vlc in 9.10 right now. lets see if its better
vlc on 9.10 is not having the same issues.. so perhaps the next vlc will work better  :)
there are vlc daily build ppa's i think
wonder if somthing else was sucking down too much cpu?
